titlestmt.titleproper: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia buildings records 1898-1998 1960s- 1980s
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia buildings records

bioghist.p: The Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia was founded in 1812 "for the encouragement and cultivation of the sciences, and the advancement of useful learning." Its collections, acquired through expeditions, gifts, purchases, and exchanges, contain over 17,000,000 specimens. The Academy opened its doors to the public in 1828, growing so rapidly that it outgrew its building three times in sixty years. In 1876, its present home was built at 19th and Benjamin Franklin Parkway.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of architectural plans and papers related to the buildings occupied by the Academy of Natural Sciences. Included are blueprints of the Academy's 19th street complex and renovations, 1970s; schematic diagrams and blueprints of Academy spaces, 1979-1981; files on 19th St. garden and Quarry Street house, 1963; a framed print by Tom Jackson showing the Academy's 19th and Race fa√ßade; 1979 plans for a projection booth; study reports for renovations to Research Wing and the new 1990 wing adjacent to it; papers related to the sale of a building on Fairmount; proposals for a biochemical laboratory; evaluations of space; diagrams of the layout for some of the research collections that were moved, circa 1980, to the research facility in the historic insurance building at the other end of the Ben Franklin Parkway; plans for Academy buildings proposed for the Penn's landing site, 1963; an architectural elevation of the north side of the Race Street building showing proposed new roof, 1905; an architectural elevation in watercolor of a low-rise building, possibly one proposed for the Parkway, 1973; and a zoning notice from the City of Philadelphia for the erection of the 1990 wing to house the new library stacks.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: ANSP Buildings and Grounds (collection 584 ).
